TopicTitle: are you loyal to your kerbals?

Articles.Content:
I've had KSP since December and i have pretty much been playing non stop since then, I literally have not played any other game at all. sure i'll get frustrated or sick of it every now and again, but thats when i go watch a movie or tv show i have downloaded. 

do any of you feel the same way or do you cheat on Jeb and Val with other games?
I play counter-strike and other games, but ksp mostly.

I play other games, 

Team fortress 2, minecraft, left 4 dead, rollercoaster tycoon 3 (I know!), OpenTTD, Also on my desktop is spacechem, papers, please, uplink, survivalist, elder scrolls oblivion, dig-n-rig, Path of exile, Im sure im forgetting another very important game...

I play Age of Empires every once in a while, some Elite: Dangerous, though specifically I've been into a lot of games with a weird storyline to them. I finished up Catherine and absolutely loved it for its particularly weird genre mixing and finishing up Life is Strange, which is beautiful.

Last night was my first revisit to KSP in a while. After failing twice to recover Jeb from his crashed Munar lander, I moved house and got out of orbit with KSP. Started playing a few classics in the interim: SimCity 4, Cosmonautica, and then got completed addicted to Mount and Blade: Warband. After defeating Calradia, and the excitement with New Horizons in real life, my head is back in the stars. Started a new career campaign last night with lots of new energy and focus on what I want to accomplish!
Cities Skylines is a huge time sink atm. That and KSP is all I need. Although I might flirt with Fallout IV when it's there.
I stopped playing KSP about a month ago, aside from modding. Right now I'm engrossed with Factorio and occasionally play some Skyrim.
Name a planet and a kerbal has been stranded there either by accident or puporsley.

I don't play KSP much now - but i return every couple of days when i get an idea for a cool mission. Or just want to decompress in a soothing silence of space ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) In the meantime i play some X-Com, Crusader Kings II, Distant Worlds and Marvel Heroes.

I'm an old guy. I play KSP and Words With Friends. That's it. Used to play Civ II and the like when I was in college. Before that it was pinball when I had quarters to spend and Atari 2600 when I didn't.
I keep trying to cheat on KSP with Cities:Skylines and Civ 5 but it's never more than a brief fling before I come crawling back. The KSP is a harsh mistress.

I play KSP 2 or 3 times a week - usually for 1 to 3 hours... Then I also started modding - which takes the same amount of times.

Every 1 or 2 weeks I play Starcraft-2 with some friends.

Luckily I only have to work 4 days a week ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif).

I tried to play Neverwinter Nights 2 a couple weeks ago, but I wasn't an hour into the game when I found myself daydreaming about a new space station..... I got it bad.... ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif)

I consider my Kerbals to be in suspended animation when KSP is paused or not running, so it's none of their concern how much time I spend on other games. In Kerbal time things just proceed normally.

So I play plenty of other games off and on.

you all disgust me!

jk i'm just surprised that i'm the only who hasnt picked up another game

<--- Thoroughly addicted to KSP

It will take another addiction to break me of it, probably. Though I do still play Planetside 2.
My main game is Arma 2 CO. I have it instaled on Both my PC and my Laptop. KSP i have only on my laptop, and play it on bussines trips and so.

I play mostly KSP. When I don't want to, I play mostly Witcher 2. I'd like to play some space sci-fi stuff but thanks to KSP, I'd probably yell at them because of their "physics" ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
When Fallout 4 comes out in a few months I think KSP will be sidelined for awhile
Oh. Thought he ment. Not killing Kerbals for fun and profit. Leave no Kerbal behind type thing. But, do take brakes from KSP. Since time has stopped for the Kerbals. So why not?

I was playing Cities: Skylines (and LOVING it) before getting sucked into KSP. At some point I'll start playing it again, it's the city sim I've been dying to play for years, and I've been playing them since the original.

Also Terraria got a big update a while back so that's waiting for me.

But in a lot of ways KSP is the perfect game for me. I'm sure you can guess I like sandbox games, and this is kind of the ultimate sandbox. Build complex machines to tackle the most complex of tasks, and the very term "kerbal" has become synonymous with thinking outside the box in sometimes janky or hilarious ways.

I can't remember when I actually bought KSP, but since then I have racked up about 150 hours of gameplay. The only game I can remember playing since buying KSP is the Witcher III, in which I played 6 hours total and came crawling back to Jeb. I do get tired of it sometimes, and going to the Mun and Min and then Duna gets a little tedious, but after a while I hear a beautiful Scottish voice in the back of my head telling me to come back and keep going.

I usually keep one computer/monitor on the side logged in to EvE Online.

But on the main viewer it's KSP, KSP related research, KSP related code research (and some coding) or work.
Still mostly ksp, but a bit of borderlands 2 when I get frustrated. Then when THAT frustrates me I go back to ksp which is then less frustrating. Vicious circle...

By the way, if anyone is up for a fling, current [Humble Weekly Bundle](https://www.humblebundle.com/weekly) has "pay what you want" for a bunch of space-themed games. "Interplanetary" aka Scorched Tanks meet KSP's planetary system, StarMade aka Minecraft in Space, Edge of Space (space themed Terraria), and for $10+ Reassembly (Spore with VAB?).
